alert.note: Alert for Washington (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 28 at 9:22PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 315 AM EDT SATURDAY... * WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southeast Ohio, including the following county, Washington. * WHEN...Until 315 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Flooding of creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 919 PM EDT, a river gauge report indicated that water levels of West Fork Creek at Macksburg have reached flood stage. Flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the warned area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Macksburg. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Report flooding to the National Weather Service by calling toll free, 800 401 9535, when you can do so safely.
